info.name: Azure Defender Arc Extension RP Installation
info.description:
These request collections provide example usage of Azure Defender for Arc enabled K8S API requests

Required parameters:

1. Subscription ID
2. Resource group name
3. Arc connected cluster name
4. Azure authorization token (see below on how to retrieve this value)

Set these variables under this collection scope for your convenience.

To extract your Azure authorization token you can run via Azure CLI:
az account get-access-token --subscription <your-subscription-id>


For more information on ways to extract/provide auth tokens for usage in Postman see:

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/servicebus/get-azure-active-directory-token#use-postman-to-get-the-azure-ad-token

Tested with Postman v7 - might not be compatible with earlier releases.

request.description:
Use this API to install the extension, mandatory parameters are:
1. logAnalytics.workspaceId
2. logAnalytics.key

Please provide the parameters in the Body section below & uncomment the optional parameters if required (see documentation).

Provide your subscription id, resource group, Arc cluster name & Azure access token in the collections' variables (collection edit -> variables) or set them manually (replace at URI & Authorization tab)

Subsequent calls to this API after installation will update the extension params if needed.
Any configuration under ProtectedConfigurationSettings will NOT be returned in any responses from the RP (GET/DELETE/PUT...).

Use this API to check for extension instance information such as install state.

Provide your subscription id, resource group, Arc cluster name & Azure access token in the collections' variables (collection edit -> variables) or set them manually (replace at URI & Authorization tab)

Notice that your protected configuration settings (provided at extension installation) will not be returned.

Use this API to delete the extension instance from your cluster.

Provide your subscription id, resource group, Arc cluster name & Azure access token in the collections' variables (collection edit -> variables) or set them manually (replace at URI & Authorization tab)
